name: Anand Behara
summary: Software Engineer with expertise in full-stack development, distributed systems, and AI/ML applications. Experienced in building scalable systems and real-time applications.

experiences.title: Research Assistant
experiences.company: Carnegie Mellon University - Dept. of Electrical and Computer Engineering
bullets: Architected and deployed an end-to-end real-time ASL recognition system for Apple Vision Pro, integrating data ingestion, model serving, and on-device inference to support 200+ FPS hand-tracking input with sub-20ms end-to-end on-device inference latency

Developed a SwiftUI-based data collection app with real-time hand tracking (100+ features per frame), cloud-backed storage, and deterministic dataset generation, which streamlined data acquisition for model training and reduced preprocessing effort

Built a modular training and deployment pipeline in Python using PyTorch and CoreML, enabling reproducible experiments, automated model versioning, model artifact management, and low-latency visionOS inference across iterative deployment cycles

Prototyped an automated programming assignment grader as an IntelliJ plugin, combining dynamic code analysis with backend services to deliver structured, actionable feedback at scale across diverse student programming submissions at university scale

Implemented a containerized RESTful service with tRPC in Docker to execute unit-test-based code evaluation, publishing results asynchronously for downstream consumption, which reduced grading latency and improved reliability of the evaluation pipeline

experiences.title: Full Stack Engineer Intern
bullets: Designed and implemented a type-safe full-stack architecture with TypeScript, Next.js, tRPC, Prisma, and PostgreSQL, enabling secure draft-based workflows for AI-assisted police report submission and improving data integrity through strict schema enforcement

Integrated GPT-4â€“powered dynamic form generation with streaming responses, schema validation (Zod), and LiveKit-based speech-to-text pipelines to streamline report filing, reducing completion time by 30% across 25+ dynamic form fields in production

experiences.title: Software Engineer Intern (R&D)
bullets: Developed a feature-flag management platform using Golang, Angular, and PostgreSQL, reducing deployment turnaround time by 25% by enabling independent feature toggling for DevOps teams across multiple internal services and deployment environments
Integrated real-time API metrics and audit logging for over 80 internal services, improving system uptime by 25% for Flows team by eliminating manual release dependencies

education.degree: Bachelor of Science, Computer Science and Engineering

projects.name: Emergency Social Network
bullets: Engineered a real-time emergency response platform using TypeScript/Express/MongoDB/Socket.io stack with MapboxGL integration, featuring live user presence, chat rooms, and broadcast status using along with 434 unit tests under simulated load

projects.name: Old Souls Website
bullets: Engineered a Next.js 15 / React 18 web platform using shadcn/ui and TailwindCSS, delivering responsive, accessible user flows and interactive form-driven experiences for senior pet adoption with planned donation portal and secure payment integration
